what: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: package provides functions analysis clinical drug-drug interaction (DDI) risk per relevant FDA EMA guidelines.

title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: can install development version ddir using:
code: devtools::install_github("rstrotmann/ddir")

title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: package provides sample data fictional drug, examplinib. following code calculates perpetrator DDI risk direct CYP inhibition (basic method) provides markdown-formatted output table: See also: kinetic_cyp_induction_risk_table(), mech_stat_cyp_risk_table(), basic_ugt_inhibition_risk_table(), transporter_inhibition_risk_table() Full documentation can found github.
code: library(ddir)  p <- examplinib_compounds[[1]] property_table(p) basic_cyp_inhibition_risk_table(p, examplinib_cyp_inhibition_data)

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: function evaluates clinical risk direct (reversible) CYP inhibition according basic model defined relevant regulatory guideines.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
code: basic_cyp_inhibition_risk(perp, cyp_inh)

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibition data data frame.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: basic modeling direct (reversible) CYP enzyme inhibition, ratios relevant inhibitor concentration \(K_i\) considered, .e., \(R_1\) hepatic enzymes \(R_{1,gut}\) intestinal enzymes (refer fig. 1  FDA guidance). threshold 1.02 applies. Note section 5.3.3.1 EMA DDI guidance defines ratio \(R_1=\frac{I_{max,ss,u}}{K_{,u}}\) threshold 0.02.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: $$R_{1,gut}=1+\frac{I_{gut}}{K_{,u}}$$ Refer documentation key_concentrations() function details calculation \(I_{max,ss,u}\) \(I_{gut}\).

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
text: function evaluates clinical risk reversible inhibition UGT enzymes according relevant FDA EMA guidelines.

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
code: basic_ugt_inhibition_risk(perp, ugt_inh)

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. ugt_inh UGT inhibition data data frame, 'value' representing IC50 (!).

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
text: function assumes UGT inhibition data provided \(IC_{50}\). According Cheng, Prusoff 1973), \(K_i\) can assumed \(IC_{50}/2\) experimental conditions commonly used vitro ihibition studies substrate concentrations close \(K_M\) used. relevant metric basic modeling UGT inhibition risk \(R_1=I_{max,ss,u}/K_{,u}\). clinical risk assessment, cut-\(R<1.02\) applies. Refer documentation key_concentrations() function details calculation \(I_{max,ss,u}\).

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: obj perpetrator object. qh Hepatic blood flow l/min, defaults 1.616 l/min. qent Enteric blood flow l/min, defaults 0.3 l/min = 18 l/h. molar Boolean value select output molar concentrations.

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: orally administered (parent) compounds, hepatic inlet concentration sytemic concentration plus portal term: $$portal\ term = D*\frac{F_a*F_g*k_a}{Q_h*R_B}*1000\ ng/ml$$ \(D\) administered dose mg, \(F_a\) fraction absorbed oral administration, \(F_g\) fraction available gut metabolism, \(k_a\) absorption rate, \(Q_h\) hepatic blood flow \(R_B\) blood--plasma ratio. relevant hepatic inlet concentration (\(I_{max,inlet,u}\), also called \(I_h\) mechanistic static modeling equations) concentration sum maximal systemic plasma concentration portal contribution: $$I_{max,inlet,u}=(I_{max,ss} + portal\ term) * f_u$$

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: orally administered (parent) compounds, villous concentration gut (\(I_{enteric}\), also called \(I_g\) mechanistic static modeling equations) calculated : $$I_{enteric,u} = D * \frac{F_a*k_a}{Q_{ent}} *1000\ ng/ml$$ \(F_a\) fraction absorbed oral administration, \(k_a\) absorption rate, \(Q_{ent}\) enteric villous blood flow \(R_B\) blood--plasma distribution ratio compound. Note per FDA guideline (refer FDA, 2020, Fig. 7, Rostami-Hodjegan Tucker, 2004) blood--plasma ratio plasma binding drug ignored.

title: Make perpetrator object — make_perpetrator
text: name compound name character. dose clinical dose mg. imaxss (total) steady-state Cmax ng/ml. mw molar weight g/mol. type compound type character. Must either 'parent' metabolite'. oral Oral administration Boolean. Defaults TRUE. fu fraction unbound numeric. Defaults 1. fumic fraction unbound microsomes. Defaults 1. rb blood--plasma concentration ratio. Defaults 1. fa fraction absorbed. Defaults 1. fg fraction escaping gut metabolism. Defaults 1. ka absorption rate constant /ml. Defaults 0.1 /ml. solubility aqueus solubility mg/l. Defaults Inf,

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: approach, AUC ratios probe substrates calculated based known intestinal hepatic metabolism. direct (competitive) time-dependent inhibition considered. formula given FDA guideline (refer fig. 7 FDA 2020) also includes intestinal hepatic enzyme induction terms (\(C_g\) \(C_h\), respectively). time, guideline states inhibition induction considered separately. $$AUCR = \frac{1}{A_g*B_g*C_g* \left(1-F_g \right)+F_g} * \frac{1}{A_h*B_h*C_h*f_m+\left(1-f_m\right)}$$ individual terms :

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$C_g = 1 + \frac{d*E_{max}*I_g}{I_g+EC_{50}}$$ $$C_h = 1 + \frac{d*E_{max}*I_h}{I_h+EC_{50}}$$ hepatic inlet concentration \(I_h=I_{max,inlet,u}\) intestinal concentration \(I_g=I_{enteric,u}\), see key_concentrations(). \(d\) induction scaling factor (assumed 1, can adjusted).

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
text: file expected comply following: Comments start '#' go end line lines format: drug, parameter, value, source fields within line comma-separated fields plain text without enclosing "" source field reference usually refers clinical non-clinical study report. source field may remain empty. Note line ends comma. metabolites, fields dose, fa, fg ka relevant filled NA. metabolites, 'oral' must 'FALSE'. Note multiple compounds, e.g., parent metabolites may included perpetrator file. typical compound file look e.g., like :
code: # name, param, value, source   # parent    examplinib,  oral,     TRUE,   examplinib,  mw,       492.6,   examplinib,  dose,     450,       clinical dose   examplinib,  imaxss,   3530,      study 001   examplinib,  fu,       0.023,     study 002   examplinib,  fumic,    1,         default   examplinib,  rb,       1,         study 003   examplinib,  fa,       0.81,      study 003   examplinib,  fg,       1,         default   examplinib,  ka,       0.00267,   unknown    # metabolite    M1,  oral,   FALSE,   M1,  mw,     506.56,   M1,  dose,   NA,   M1,  imaxss, 1038,      study 001   M1,  fu,     0.012,     study 002   M1,  fumic,  1,         default   M1,  rb,     1,         study 002   M1,  fa,     NA,   M1,  fg,     NA,   M1,  ka,     NA,

text: basic (EMA) fold-change (FDA) methods evaluate whether maximal fold-change mRNA expression > 2-fold expected unbound hepatic concentration drug. Regarding relevant drug concentrations, FDA guidance suggests considering \(30*I_{max,ss,u}\) EMA guidance considers \(50*I_{max,ss,u}\) hepatic \(0.1*I_{gut}\) intestinal CYP enzyme induction. expected concentrations respective vitro assays cover concentrations.

title: Drug transporter inhibition risk — transporter_inhibition_risk
Drug transporter inhibition risk — transporter_inhibition_risk
text: relevant metric assessment transporter interactions \(R=[]/K_i\). vitro transporter inhibition studies, \(IC_{50}\) values experimentally determined. Since transporter substrate concentration usually kept low relation \(K_m\) minimize passive permeation, \(K_i = IC_{50}\) can assumed. relevant perpetrator concentrations \([]\) : \(I_{gut}\) intestinal P-gp BRCR \(I_{max,inlet,u}\) hepatic basolateral transporters OCT1, OATP1B1 OATP1B3 \(I_{max,ss,u}\) renal basolateral transporters OAT1, OAT3 OCT2, well apical transporters outside intestinal mucosa, .e., hepatic P-gp BCRP, MATE1, MATE2-k. Note FDA EMA guidelines differ definitions thresholds assumed clinically relevant effects.
